Description: Concave or ‘hollow’-base arrowhead of flint with incurving barbs, bifacially worked with very fine retouch along the edges.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (7, 37; pl. xxix.6) (lower left)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
